result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Briyana C Meadows

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Briyana C Meadows appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Briyana C Meadows.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer A. Kissler.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Briyana C Meadows appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Briyana C Meadows.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Unable to proceed due to court congestion. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Potawatomi Bingo Casino, Samuel G., Kyla L.Y. & co-def: Chimar McCoy
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Briyana C Meadows in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Briyana C Meadows in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Briyana C Meadows appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Briyana C Meadows
Current: 751 Timberline Trial Apt 1, Hartford, WI 53027 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2022)
Prior: 2744 N. 28th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Briyana C Meadows not in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@2:00pm
